text: Gordon Thomas Stuart (30 May 1924 22 July 2015) was a Canadian-born Welsh portrait artist, known for his portrayals of Dylan Thomas. Stuart was born in Toronto, Ontario, Canada and attended Ontario College of Art and Design. He met Thomas in 1953 and completed an oil sketch of Thomas and three oil paintings, one in the National Gallery of Art in London, one at SUNY, and one located in the Uplands in Thomas's home.Karen Price, Artist Gordon Stuart who painted Dylan Thomas' final portrait dies at the age of 91, Wales Online, Cardiff, accessed at 24 July 215 at 12:58 Stuart also completed portraits of Jimmy Carter, Sir Kyffin Williams, Aeronwy Thomas, Sir George Martin, and Cliff Morgan.BBC Staff, Artist who painted last portrait of Dylan Thomas dies BBC News, London, accessed 24 July 2015 Stuart served in the Canadian Army during World War II and after returning to Canada, later lived in Paris and London before settling in Wales. == References == Category:2015 deaths Category:1924 births Category:Artists from Toronto Category:Welsh artists Category:Canadian people of World War II Category:Canadian painters
